fields.description:
Hello,

since the deprecation of POST or Pull Request POST services in bitbucket is impossible to find out from the payload which files where changed with the last commits. Originally you could retrieve this information from payload commits -> files array

Example:

----
h2. "files":[\\
{\\
"type":"modified",\\
"file":"CHANGELOG"\\
},\\
{\\
"type":"modified",\\
"file":"README.md"\\
}\\
],
Since this service is deprecated there is not an alternative way to get this data. The new repo:push payload doesn't have this information anymore nor other type of payloads.

Also there is no API equivalent call to retrieve only the file changed by the commit SHA1. Possible workaround would be to use the GET https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/{owner}/{repo_slug}/diff/{spec} API call and to parse the result looking for file changed, but it's a hacky solution.

Having a feature like that can benefit automation tools and services which trigger certain action based on the files changes. Having this data as part of the payload avoid the need of having git / git library inspecting the repository itself for this information.
fields.summary: Add modified file list in the repo:push payload(BB-14095)

Hi,\\

fields.description:
The "Find a repository..." input field is too small and does not take into consideration long repository names where the first handful of characters are the same. See attached image.

!1201171271-Bitbucket_Repository_Search_Bug.png|thumbnail!

For example, companies (like mine) begin all our repositories with the same owner "accedo/" and then my team has a convention of beginning repository names with "tvc-display". These same characters completely fill the input field and the search tool returns three matches but I cannot effectively choose the right one because I cannot see any more characters.

Sometimes I have had success with wildcards, but not always, like I cannot enter *xyz to locate the repositories that end with the characters "xyz". I end up in the wrong repository and am forced to redo my search, typing blindly because I cannot see what I am typing beyond the input field.

At the very least, expand the width of the search field – you have plenty of space in the header. For an even better solution, support wildcards at the beginning, middle, and end of the search term and do not require the owner prefix ("accedo/" in my example).
fields.summary: Widen suggested results dropdown field when searching for a repository(BB-14093)

fields.description:

Consider a text file with placeholder (like <<COMMIT>>) which would be automatically replaced with the commit number, when showing or downloading this file and <<LINK>> which would be automatically replaced with the link of the source files for this commit. (This is for a fixed commit, not the last commit and not the commit of this text file itself.)
fields.summary: Add automatic BibTeX reference creation (BB-14640)

fields.description:
Considering that Bitbucket exposes OAuth1 endpoints via {{https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/oauth/<something>}} could be done something similar for OAuth2 ? (_which currently is at {{https://bitbucket.org/site/oauth2/<something>}}_)

Maybe something like {{https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/oauth2/<something>}}.

This could be useful for API client libraries which defined their base URL as  {{https://api.bitbucket.org}} and at this point in time they need to be reconfigured before and after  making a request on a OAuth2 endpoint (_like https://bitbucket.org/site/oauth2/access_token for example_).

fields.description:
See how GitHub does it: https://github.com/jscs-dev/node-jscs/pull/1682 (the "All checks have passed" section).

Right now if you have an automated reviewer setup it needs to leave comments (with details regarding what failed) as any other real person and if you also have multiple comments from other people there it gets kind of hard to see who's who and who said what.

Having a dedicated section (somewhere at the top of the PR before the comments section) where tools like this could mark the PR validated or not, and also where they could add/update the errors generated by the automated review process would be really helpfull.
fields.summary: Add a dedicated section for automated builders/reviewers on the pull request view (and the API needed to integrate with this)

fields.description:
Hello,

Is there any way in the new API 2.0 or Web-hooks components to get *a list of the files which were actually added/modified/deleted* in a commit (or in all commits which were pushed)?

The reason I'm asking is because I need to know how I can modify my [BitBucket Sync|https://bitbucket.org/alixandru/bitbucket-sync] project to work with the new API. BitBucket Sync is a lightweight PHP script, designed to run on a web-server, which can deploy repository files to the web-server as they are pushed to specific branches. Think of it as a super-lightweight CI server, which uses nothing but hooks and API calls to keep an web-site updated with what's in the BitBucket repository.

Now, a few words about how this script works: in order to reduce deployment time and bandwidth, the script copies over (from BitBucket to the web-server)* *only* those files which were ADDED and UPDATED* (instead of getting a zip with the entire repository content at each push).

In order for this to work, the script needs to know the list of files changed in each commit; and this information, unfortunately, is not available anymore in the new API.

Is there any chance to include this piece of info in the new Web-hooks? If not, is there (or will there be) any API call to give me this info? Without it, the BitBucket Sync script would be pointless...

Let me know if you need more information.

Thanks in advance!\\
Alex

----
The BitBucket Sync script can be accessed here: https://bitbucket.org/alixandru/bitbucket-sync\\
Discussion about this has also been started here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Event+Payloads?focusedCommentId=774045711&#comment-774045711
fields.summary: List of modified files in repository-push webhook

fields.description:
The authoring date exists in git for a reason. When I open a commit, I want to see when the code was written, not when the commit was last touched by a rebase.

Indeed, Mercurial, Bitbucket’s other main VCS, stores _only_ the authoring date and not the commit date, so Bitbucket is handling its two supported VCSs very differently in this respect.

Even more confusingly, Bitbucket currently shows the author’s name rather than the commiter’s, and yet the commit date rather than the authoring date. At the very least it should be consistent.

I imagine you’re not very fond of comparisons to GitHub, but just as another point of reference, GitHub shows the author and date first and foremost, and _additionally_ shows the committer and commit date in small print if and only if the committer is a different person.
fields.summary: Show authoring dates rather than commit dates in commit view (BB-14058)
Issue when inviting user to a repository. (BB-14060)

fields.description: We have one private repository and 20+ branches. We need to trigger a build only when change is pushed to a particular branch say branch3. For that purpose we created Webhook and added a rule stating that if Pull request is approved and merged then the build will be triggered. but we have observed that, build is getting triggered on any pull request approval. Eg. If pull request is approved for branch2 then webhook is being triggered. We want to trigger a build only and only when there is change pushed to a particular branch.
fields.summary: Triggering a build only when the change is pushed to a particular branch

fields.description:
After a pull request is created, the pull request cannot be moved to a different HEAD.

I am in a situation were I required a rebase/merge operation to fix a merge conflict and the pull request did not update to reflect.  If I click "Edit" in the pull request, the commits listed at the bottom are correct.  After I select "Update Pull Request", BitBucket returns to the pull request page, but the commits as seen in the commits tab are still the previous SHA1 identifiers (or whatever type mercurial uses).

Also, I cannot seem to change the branch of the "Pull" location when editting the pull request.  No branches or tags other than Default are available.
fields.summary: Unable to correctly update HG pull request. (BB-14061)

fields.description:
It seems impossible to navigate to a file or a comment in a bitbucket commit.

As commit comments create action items, we wish to be able to link JIRA issues to the comment (specifically) and file (generally) in a commit.

There are a number of open issues related to automatically creating JIRA issues from a  comment (see, for example BCLOUD-11166 and BCLOUD-7039); my attempt at a work around (copying the URL from the commit list of files, e.g., https://bitbucket.org/generocloud/gcloud/commits/f963fc939c30c3e7514bb580ca889e2bf3fd9c1b#chg-cookbooks/collectd/files/default/ps_user_count) fails as well.

Basically there is no reasonable way to link commits and issues except _after_ the issue has been created and _before_ the commit is made.  But this is only 1/2 (and the lesser 1/2) of the problem: more often we see a problem in code and want to create the issue - but the commit has already been made!  So we need workflow that takes code review (in various places: commits, commit comments, pull requests and the commits and comments in the pull requests) and both automates creation of the issue, and allows linking issues to the commit or comment that _has no JIRA issue tag_.

Pull requests support this (we can create action items _in the pull request_) from comments - but we want to create _JIRA issues_ - not pul request action items!

We're looking at Atlassian because it purports to be an integrated product management suite - this is a key missing feature!
fields.summary: Create JIRA issue directly from commit or pull request (BB-14062)

fields.summary: Repository name missing from email notifications

fields.description:
It seems that with the fix for BCLOUD-6315, path-absolute links that used to resolve now are translated into broken links. For example, I used to link to issues in other projects like so: See [Setuptools 230|/pypa/setuptools/issues/230]. If that had been rendered by Bitbucket months ago, it would have resolved to the issue in the bitbucket project. Today, it resolves as a file in the source tree for project in which the issue was filed.

I see that [at least one other person found the change problemmatic|BCLOUD-6315].

I admit that the server-relative, path-absolute links may have been an incidental function that worked only because it relied on the browser's link resolution convention (where path-absolute links are resolved server-relative). I suspect few users ever knew this function existed, and even fewer used it.

However, the effect is that many of the comments I've made are now broken.

I am mostly filing this report to create a record of the issue. It would be helpful if Bitbucket could run a report of posts (issue descriptions, wikis, and comments), preferably indexed by the user who made them, that make server-relative path references before the change was made. Then, I could go through the report and correct those comments. Even better would be to proactively re-write them with absolute HREFs.

I acknowledge that might be a lot of work with a small payoff, so if you choose to close this as won't fix, I understand, and I'll correct the broken links as I encounter them.
fields.summary: Path-absolute links broken
Missing SCM and is_private info from "Bitbucket-Webhooks/2.0" notification (BB-13953)

fields.description:
from Bitbucket blog post [The new Bitbucket webhooks|http://blog.bitbucket.org/2015/06/24/the-new-bitbucket-webhooks/], it mention in the comment that old hook ("services") will be deprecated in 6 months.

Question:

# existing REST api to set hook, if it is called after deprecated, will it fail or it will result in adding new hook?
# the already setup service url, will it stop working after deprecated or will continues to work
# if answer to No.2 is stop working, is there any plan to help us to migrate to new webhook?

one solution will be before deprecated the old API, Bitbucket automatically added a  webhook for each old services, and Bitbucket always emit webhook notification first, only if it fail then fall back to the old service notification.\\
in this case, will make our migration much more easier.
fields.summary: Need support to migrate old hook to new webhook (BB-13965)

fields.description:
Hi,

Bitbucket incorrectly calculates the number of users to charge you for. This is happening for me; but I will give an example of how it can happen to anyone.

# I was invited to join a team, and then fork one of the repositories
# As part of the standard review process, I am required to add-in a group which that team controls. It contains 3 members (I am well within my 5 user count).
# work continues
# They add additional people, bringing the number in the team *that they control* to 3000.

Who should pay for those extra 3000 users? The currently bitbucket algorithm believes that _I_ should.

I think the algorithm to determine users should be fairly simple:

{code}
def users_chargable_on_repo(repo):
    to_charge = count_direct_users(repo)
    to_charge += count_users_within_groups_created_by_repo_forker(repo)
{code}

And then obviously you would tally up all users across all repos and then put into a set (so they aren't duplicated), giving you a total number to charge.

In my case the number should be 2. Which is under the 5 free threshold.

If you are able to give me a (rough) outline of the current algorithm and\\
some test cases, I am sure I could easily come up with a correct solution\\
for you.

As you can imagine, I am highly motivated to fix this billing problem.

Thanks,\\
Anand
fields.summary: Bitbucket incorrectly calculates number of users associated with a repository. (BB-13948)

fields.description:
Currently the hipchat bit bucket integration has 4 notification options for pull requests: created, commented, merged, declined.

Please can you add a fifth so that reviewer approvals can be optionally sent to hipchat?
fields.summary: Add 'approvals' pull request notification option to hipchat bitbucket integration

fields.description: Got confused by the UI and ended up posting in the wrong issue queue, please delete this.
fields.summary: Wrong issue queue....

fields.description:
Hello,\\
i looked to github and with git blame file i can see revision in sections delimited by lines - more easy identify what sources code was added by revision. i'm using Bitbucket a like it\\
but, it is not easy identify code section by revisions in blamed tree - coloured revisions is fine, but where is delta of code what was added by commit - not easy define it.\\
could you please add lines or another delimiter for code sections?\\
best regards,\\
-Igor
fields.summary: bitbucket UI: show git blame more friendly (BB-13836)

fields.description: If a repo is private and belongs to a team organization, then there should be an option to allow captcha to be disabled when uploading files to the "Downloads" section. Otherwise, it is an annoyance for all authorized team members.
fields.summary: Ability to disable captcha in "Downloads panel" for private repo

fields.description: The ability to specify / configure which email address to send the notifications to at the repo level would be great!
fields.summary: Feature Request: Ability to configure e-mail at repo level

fields.description:
The multi-part e-mail bitbucket sends for commits has a text part, which looks like this:

----
XY has pushed commits to user/repo.

You can view commits for this repository at the following link:

https://bitbucket.org/user/repo/commits/

Commits:

https://bitbucket.org/user/repo/commits//hash

...

----
You can see that the commit link below Commits: has a double slash before the commit hash, which makes the link broken. This is fine in the html part of the mail.
fields.summary: Git commit notification e-mail link broken

fields.description:
When parsing links like "PR BCLOUD-60", the webUI incorrectly links to issue number 60 instead of pull request number 60.

"PR BCLOUD-60" should be treated the same as "[PR#60|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/pull-requests/60]".
fields.summary: Linkify "PR #<number>", not just "pull request #<number>"

fields.description:
I tried cloning a project repository to my workplace,it goes on well till 42% completion but hangs after that.!!\\
Tried access with different id and password..there is no issue with passwords
fields.summary: Cloning a repository stucks at 42%

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to have the option to limit the max file size allowed during commit.

Quote:\\
Conditions for large files\\
GitHub will warn you when pushing files larger than 50 MB. You will not be allowed to push files larger than 100 MB.

https://help.github.com/articles/working-with-large-files/
fields.summary: Ability to limit file size in commit (BB-10101)
Webhook requests being sent as GET requests to Rails server
2 Step Verification

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

Create a new Pull request and merged that.\\
Then get an old Pull request from a few days ago and hit on disapprove and then in approve again.\\
The result will be that you will get the old pull request on the top of the Merged Pull Requests with the currently date.

This cause a mess to look for more recent merged pull requests since they are now intermixed with older ones.
fields.summary: Pull Requests are only recording the most recent date of change (BB-6999)
Unable to list other bitbucket repo while creating pull request

fields.description:
When go into Commits > commit detail view, there is a branch information displayed if the commit was not on master.\\
It would be actually good to display it always, as with different branching models and comparing different commits this is useful to see at glance to which branch the commit refers to.
fields.summary: Always show branch name in the commit view

fields.description:
# Create a repository.
# Delete it.

In the audit log the following appears: _<whoami> created <repo-name>_ -- but it should display the delete event.

I deleted a repository I created some time ago, and the message is _Ionică Bizău CREATED a repository_ while I expected to see _Ionică Bizău DELETED a repository_.
fields.summary: Invalid event name in audit log (BB-13858)
Create Issue> Can not create a bug without selected Resolution

fields.description:
The repository push webhook should contain all pushed commits (as the POST service does). You say the POST service will be deprecated soon, but when do you include its functionality to the push webhook?\\
You can only get the last commit from the push webhook, not all that were pushed.
fields.summary: Repository push webhook should show all commits

fields.description:
I'm on a couple teams and have separate email addresses for each. I also have my personal email address for repos that aren't associated with any team.

I'd like to receive notifications at the separate email addresses so I don't have to check my work email when I'm working on a personal project, or an email address associated with a different team. This leads to distractions and general unpleasantness.
fields.summary: Separate notification email addresses per team/repo

fields.description: When on the Edit group dialog, changed Default access from None to Read, clicked Save button. An error message popped up with a red alert symbol and the message "632551" but the change was successful. Screen shot of dialog attached.
fields.summary: Strange error message when changing read/write access to group (BB-13811)

fields.description:
In order to keep track of our own work, we would like to be notified by actions that we started/created/pushed/triggered such as:

* Commits
* Forks
* Pulls
* Comments
* Issues
* Wiki changes

These notifications are currently sent to the other users that have access to the same content so, we believe that it is possible to include the "committer" of the changes on the notification list.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Need action notification emails for own commits or other watched actions of a repository (BB-13812)

fields.description: It would be nice to have customers have the option of using Google's OID-Connect (or at least converting the old OID accounts to use this). An example of such implementation could be: https://github.com/rohe/pyoidc
fields.summary: Support Google OID-Connect / Convert old Google OID accounts (BB-13813)

fields.description: My repo "seytar/keyps-container" was lost. I'am not deletion repository, i am sure.
fields.summary: Lost my private repository

fields.description:
{panel:title=Workaround|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
(i)
You can enable an experimental feature to trigger GC automatically next time you accidentally push a large commit and go over the [Hard size limit|https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/what-kind-of-limits-do-you-have-on-repositoryfile-size/].

Do this by clicking on your profile icon and selecting [Labs|https://bitbucket.org/account/settings/features/], then enabling the feature "{*}Delete dangling commits when over size limit{*}". This only affects your personal login, meaning that auto GC will be triggered only on the repositories part of your personal workspace and it won't be triggered on the repositories part of any shared workspace. Tell your team in case they want to try it out too.

!Screenshot 2020-03-03 15.57.48.png|thumbnail!

Next time you accidentally push large files to Bitbucket, follow the [user guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/reduce-repository-size-321848262.html] to reset the branch to just before the large commit. When you force push that refs-only change, the Labs feature will automatically run GC to immediately remove the large commit.

This should bring your Bitbucket repo below the size limit, allowing you to push commits again without having to raise a support request. Anyone else using the same repo who has pulled the large commit will need to create a fresh clone.

Note that this won't work if your repo goes over 5GB. In that case your repo is put into read-only mode and you will need to request help from our support team at [https://support.atlassian.com/contact/].
{panel}
we need a process to initiate git gc runs on server repositories.

one of our repository grew to [Hard size limit|https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/what-kind-of-limits-do-you-have-on-repositoryfile-size/] and it is read only for quite some time. We would need to bring attention of bitbucket team to near-the-limit repositories without getting tech support involved.
fields.summary: Allow users to mark repositories for git gc (BB-13894)

fields.description:
My company/team has quite a few repositories on bitbucket and I am trying to fetch the logged in user's commits for a particular day.

According to the current bitbucket API, the only way to do this is by

# Fetching all teams for the authenticated user
# Fetching all repos for each of the teams, the user is a part of
# Then fetching all the commits for each repo

Even after these three API calls,I end up with a lot of data (all commits from all branches of all the repositories the user is a part of). Then I have to filter all the commits by user and date to arrive at my final data set.

It would be great if there was a way to get commits for a start-date and end-date value. For example

https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/myAccount/commits?start_date=2015-07-20&end_date=2015-07-21
fields.summary: Get a user's commits by date via API (BB-13814)
